net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.groupNet.client

Class GroupClientCon

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.AbstractConnection
      • net.xuset.objectIO.connections.sockets.groupNet.client.GroupClientCon
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Connection, InetCon, StreamConI, MsgParsable

    public class GroupClientCon
extends AbstractConnection
implements InetCon
    Virtual connection used by GroupClientHub. This connection is a 'virtual' connection used to communicate with a different GroupClientCon on the internet without needing a real connection like TCP. The messages sent through this connection are sent to the server (GroupNetServer) and are forwarded across a real connection to the appropriate client.
    Since:
    1.0
    See Also:
    GroupNetServer

        public boolean isLoopback()
        Description copied from interface: InetCon
        Indicates if this connection is a loop back connection. In a loop back connection sent messages will be redirected to it's received messages.
        Specified by:

        Returns:

        public void flush()

      • sendMsg

        public boolean sendMsg(MarkupMsg msg)
        Description copied from interface: Connection
        Sends a MarkupMsg. Depending on the implementing class, the message could be set across a TCP stream, file stream, or some other medium.

        Implementations are free to determine how to send messages. The protocol for sending messages is also defined by the implementation.

        Specified by:
        sendMsg in interface Connection
        Specified by:
        sendMsg in class AbstractConnection
        Parameters:
        msg - message to send across the connection
        Returns:
        true if the sending the message was successful, false otherwise. It does not guarantee that the message was received.

      • isClosed

        public boolean isClosed()
        Description copied from interface: StreamConI
        Returns whether the connection has been closed.

        If the connection is closed, the connection should no longer be used. Be aware, this method can return true even though close() was never called.

        Specified by:
        isClosed in interface StreamConI
        Returns:
        true if the connection is closed, false otherwise.

      • addMsgToQueue

        protected void addMsgToQueue(MarkupMsg msg)
        Description copied from class: AbstractConnection
        This class has a queue for storing received messages. Received messages can be added to this queue by calling this method. Calling pollNextMsg() polls items added the queue.
        Overrides:
        addMsgToQueue in class AbstractConnection
        Parameters:
        msg - message to be added to the queue
        See Also:
